subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 26 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Dunfermline 0-1 Celtic
Jean-Joel Perrier Doumbe nets a late winner to take the Scottish Cup to Celtic Park.



 
Strachan relishes Celtic Double
Celtic manager Zombie Strachan enjoys watching his players having fun after their 1-0 victory over Dunfermline in the Scottish Cup final at Hampden.



 
Lennon leaves Celtic on high note
Neil Lennon is delighted to be leaving Celtic with a Scottish Cup winners medal.








GOLF




Broadhurst and Fisher share lead
Ross Fisher birdies five of the last seven holes to join Paul Broadhurst at the top of the PGA Championship leaderboard.



 
PGA Championship leaderboard
Justin Rose continues his challenge at the PGA Championship at Wentworth.



 
Cabrera moves to challenge Rose
Angel Cabrera joins Justin Rose at the top of the leaderboard at the PGA Championship at Wentworth.








MOTORSPORT




Alonso eclipses Hamilton for pole
Fernando Alonso edges out McLaren team-mate to pole position for Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Bayliss secures Silverstone pole
Troy Bayliss beats James Toseland to pole position for Sunday's World Superbikes race at Silverstone.



 
Monaco qualifying as it happened
McLaren and Ferrari renew their battle for pole in rainy conditions in Monte Carlo.








FORMULA ONE




Alonso eclipses Hamilton for pole
Fernando Alonso edges out McLaren team-mate to pole position for Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Monaco qualifying as it happened
McLaren and Ferrari renew their battle for pole in rainy conditions in Monte Carlo.



 
Dennis backs 'good guy' Hamilton
McLaren boss Ron Dennis says  Lewis Hamilton does not need to be ruthless to become Formula One world champion.








ATHLETICS




Benjamin ready to launch comeback
British 400m runner Tim Benjamin is targeting a return to his best form under new coach Colin Jackson.



 
Kenyan trio to miss World Champs
World record holder Paul Tergat is one of three Kenyan marathon stars unavailable for August's World Championships in Osaka.



 
Pavey races to Manchester victory
Britain's Jo Pavey produces a world-class performance to win the Great Manchester Run.








CYCLING




Riis told to return yellow jersey
Cycling's governing body calls on 1996 Tour de France champion Bjarne Riis to return his yellow jersey after the Dane confesses to doping.



 
Zabel admits to doping at Telekom
German cyclist Erik Zabel becomes the latest cyclist to admit to using banned blood booster EPO while competing for Telekom in the 1990s.



 
Luca regains Giro d'Italia lead
Italy's Danilo di Luca wins the 12th stage of the Giro d'Italia to take the overall leader's pink jersey.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Graham Poll gets his air guitar out as the Liverpool parade bus stays in the garage



 
Farewell West Jesmond
BBC Sport's adopted team look back on their season



 
Quotes of the Week
Lawro says what he thinks about the FA Cup final, plus Mourinho & Warnock
